column1: Any idea PCOS/Hashimotos/constant headaches ?
column2: My wife (24) has been having symptoms that even through thorough lab tests, visits to specialists, has led to no outcome. Doctors say it may be hashimotos, May be pcos, etc. through the diagnosis, a doctor found a dermoid cyst, which was taken out. All along, she has had issues with headaches. A mild ab workout or standing in the kitchen for over 10mins causes her headaches. Ona. Scale of 1-10(hitting your head on a wall) she says it‚Äôs at a 7. The max that doctors have done, is a CT of the brain without contrast, when we pushed to see if there‚Äôs something wrong. 9 months after rigorous testing and running around to multiple doctors, we want to look into getting a full body & brain MRI to see if that could show anything. Sorry for the detailed info. But I want to know which type of mri should we opt for? I don‚Äôt mind paying out of pocket, since the doctors deny it due to lack of reasons for an MRI even though they fail to diagnose her condition. Any help would be deeply appreciated.

column1: Weird undiagnosed chronic pain that has been going on for over five years
column2: Hi guys I need some input right now cause I am feeling really lost right. My body feels broken and I have never been diagnosed with anything. It all started when I 14 and I started have lower back pain for incorrect lifting techniques. The back pain is on my lower left side. Due to this pain I went to a physical therapist and he told me my left glute was not activating. During the course of pt I did glute strengthening excersises and core strengthing. The back pain lasted But I continued to play lacrosse for my school. My first year of high school lacrosse I got it and syndrome, and I pushed threw it. I rested for a while after that season and my pain decreased, but was still there when I excersised. I went back to pt for the itband syndrome but that did nothing. Then I got the bright idea to start lifting weights again and started feeling pain in my upper back. I went to pt for that and it helped slightly. I ended up fracturing my wrist around this time. I never let my wrist fully heal. To make a long story short I ended up to to pt 5 more times and none of it helped. Too make a long story short I still feel all this pain years later. I have tried injection and chiropractor care. That did not help. I‚Äôm 20 years old and lost I feel like I‚Äôm going insane and see no hope in sight. I was wondering if anyone has gone threw something similar and can help me out.

column1: Chest pains and dizziness for 17 years (T-3 to T-5 spine)
column2: I have been having this ongoing issue for 17 years now, and there doesn't seem to be any answer. I get these crazy feelings in my chest (I hesitate to call it pain because it a feeling that I don't know how to describe), and I'll get dizzy but not in the vertigo sense. If I take good care of myself, it happens less, but it still happens. When climbing steep hills/stairs I have to stop often (this has been happening from the age 18 to now 35). When the weather is over +35 C or under -35 C, I have trouble breathing and get similar symptoms. After looking into my heart and lungs, then didn't find anything, but noted I was not able to get my heart elevated to the rate they wanted for the stress test I took. After all the tests that I had, it has been discovered that I have degenerated discs between T-3 and T-5 (I have not been in any accident. I have also discovered that the left side of my body is larger than the right in some places like my arm, my calf, my ear, potentially my face, my stomach, and most importantly my left rib cage is larger than the right side (the left side being where I feel this pain). After going to a geneticist they theorize I may on a spectrum involved with Klippel-Trenaunay syndrome. I was also born with Wolf-Parkisans White but had a procedure to eliminate it. 6 years ago after a bad break-up I sought help for depression. Since then, my doctor refuses to believe that the problem is anything but panic attacks, but due to the fact that I don't behave or experience the panic attacks like a typical person he called them panic episodes and refuses to entertain anything other than putting me on anti-depressants. Last summer, I was taking a hike with a friend who is doing his residency to become a doctor, and I had to keep stopping every ten steps because of the pain in my chest. I told my friend that my doctor says that antidepressants would fix this climbing issue and my friend strongly disagreed. I should also note that if I have been drinking heavily the night before, these pains will be around all day the next day, making it impossible to do anything, other than crawl around on all four, or lay down or sit. Typically, a panic attack will last no more than an hour. For those days when I am hungover, or if I've done a lot of heavy lifting, these "attacks" go on all day and seem to be much more dependent on the position of my body, or physical exertion. My theory is because my rib cage is bigger on one side, it messed up my spine when I had a growth spurt at 18, and something neurological is going on between the T-3 to T-5. The only hope I found was a forum with other people with similar spine problems having similar symptoms. But they also don't know what do. Also once a massage therapist mentioned something about how that area of the spine is connected to the heart and lungs. I asked her if she knew what article/book she learned it from she said she didn't know. My doctor thinks its a ridiculous idea. Does anyone have any advice? Thank you.

column1: Soon-to-be 30 y/o female, debilitating symptoms and doing whatever I can to hold on to hope.
column2: I failed to keep this short. I will gladly answer any questions that may be proposed due to missed information. this all started with some occasional pain in my right shoulder, no injury or known cause. 5 years later, my entire body is affected, and my right side is losing functionality, and I'm certain my left side will follow as has been the trend. I think they are muscle cramps, maybe spasms. it's a dull and throbbing sort of pain. feels like someone is spaghetti-twirling a fork into the tissue. the main areas affected are my shoulders and hips. Good days, the pain is only focused at one part of my body-usually the right shoulder-that first problem area. the pain is severe, but it's easier to apply a heating pad to one area for relief (which is minimal but absolutely welcomed). most of the time, my body seems to be lighting up, pain pulsing throughout every limb and throughout my trunk, even in my face. I have been having strange jerking/twitching episodes, like when you're about to fall asleep and jerk awake, but this happens throughout the day, standing, sitting, lying down. it used to be minimal, but it's progressed to a point that I'm embarrassed to go out in public because it draws a lot of attention. I must include that I am prone to seizures, and while it hasn't been ruled out as a type of seizure, I've had a normal EEG while the jerking was in the early stages of presenting itself, and occuring DURING the EEG. if that's important, which I believe it is. I've recently started taking high potency CBD oil, which has helped with the twitches and weakness but not the pain so far. I've always been in good shape, physically. petite yet strong, something I've been proud of my entire life. now whenever I use my muscles, with varying amounts of strength independent of days, I am unable to relax them after the action taken. mostly in my right arm, but the left has become progressively worse now. my hand freezes up into a claw-like position. I am mostly unable to grip things, and writing has become difficult. my hips lose strength spontaneously, and I've fallen many times because of it. there are days that I'm unable to walk. there are days that I can go for hours like there's nothing wrong, but I'll almost certainly be immobile following the activity. lately I'm finding it difficult to hold my head up or keep it still, like a bobble-head almost.. I'm not sure if it's noticeable because I'm now living with my mom, she hasn't said anything about it, and she hasn't held back questions about anything else. my mental health has deteriorated. I experience paranoid delusions, heavy anxiety, depression, laughing/crying spells, and what I can only describe as some kind of peripheral hallucination or mental glitch, that always causes fleeting fear. combatting my physical problems was difficult to begin with, but now my mental health has taken a hit, so I'm struggling much more these days, and I contemplate taking my own life daily because of the pain I experience. it has worn me down. I still have so much strength, which is evident in the fact that I am still here, but I am close to a breaking point. I've exhausted my story, and I have started another round of a diagnosis journey, but I don't feel like I have another one in me if this dead-ends. what I have going for me now is that my symptoms are so much worse than they were during previous rounds, and I have zero tolerance for dismissal of healthcare providers. an EMG/nerve conduction study have recently been recommended by a PA, and I'm finally coming up on a long-awaited neurology appointment to have the tests ordered, so that's where I am currently in the process. any suggestions, tips, ideas, and - most of all - words of encouragement will not go unappreciated. i wish anyone else who is currently struggling with an illness, diagnosed or not, the best of luck in their journey. thank you to anyone who has taken the time to read. best regards. EDIT: spelling and spacing

column1: last night could have been my last night
column2: i was feeling bad. worse than my normal bad. good days don't seem to come around anymore, it gets old, and i grasp to home remedies to temporarily comfort me. i drew a bath for myself and placed my tired body in the water. closest alternative to a full-body heating pad. then it happened. my back arched, my neck down to my hips, both arms and legs, turned rigid and immoveable. my face sunk below the surface and i could not make my brain communicate to the rest of my body to move for what felt like eternity. i sucked water into my nose and throat as I fought with any amount of regained strength i felt to wedge my body into position, bringing my head back above water. i eventually managed to pull myself on to the bathroom floor once the left side of my body woke back up and continued to choke for air between the spewing of water from my face. needless to say I am no longer allowed to take unsupervised baths, which pisses me off because it's just another aspect of my independence that has been taken away from me beyond any control of my own, and I'm not yet even 30. i allowed myself to be upset about this but only momentarily because now I have proof that I am not ready for death quite yet. i don't know when that day will come, and most days, it feels imminent, but I've still got some amount of will. if i didn't, i wouldn't be here to share this with whomever is listening. I saved myself. I know i didn't have to, but i did.

column1: Undiagnosed don‚Äôt know what happened
column2: Please read this I am still suffering and I can‚Äôt take it anymore One day I was going to the gym as usual took a little extra preworkout and while in the gym my heart was really sore so I came back home. I took ‚Äúhalf beta prograne‚Äù(the doctor had prescribed it for my anxiety it slowed heart rate down) . I took 2 thinking it would help, I lay down on my bed and after some time I felt my face swelling I‚Äôm not sure What it was but my face was bright red and my pupils dilated and I felt like a fish of blood going through my head and I got scared and jumped up my face was hot and I felt so hot I had to cool down so I jumped in the shower that kinda helped. I drank 6 liters of water and everything was weird. Every time I tried to lay down I felt a rush of blood. I put pillows to keep my head up. Next day I had sever e headache and my eyes were blurry and sensitive to light. My head was so hot and sore I took ice pack to cool it down it lasted for 3 days and I felt like I couldn‚Äôt concentrate I don‚Äôt know what happened. I had a feeling like I was looking through a camera my vision was weird. I took painkillers it didn‚Äôt help my extremely sore headache never had one like that before. Weeks later I would out of no where get that same blood rush feeling in my head and my pupils would get huge. I went to the doctor the doctor said it‚Äôs vertigo but I don‚Äôt think so she gave me tablets they didn‚Äôt do anything. This is getting to long but right now I can‚Äôt focus I don‚Äôt feel the same like before my eyes and vision just imagine your camera and you looking at your phone at things just like that and I get occasional headaches. I can‚Äôt think I can‚Äôt remember things I have brain fog and I feel like the world is going faster than I am!!!! I can‚Äôt describe the feeling. I feel out of my body

column1: Intermittent fever for 10 months, can‚Äôt lose weight.
column2: 26F, 5‚Äô2 and 172 lbs, no smoking or drug using, gave birth 2013, asthmatic and on Paxil since 2015. Intermittent fever - mostly low grade - since 03/2019. Thyroid is fine, Trying to lose weight for months with lower intake (about 1000 - 1500 cal) and more exercise. Scale is not moving. Been to drs this whole time and all they can find is a slightly elevated crp, some hemoglobin in my urine and a low white blood cell count. Please help, this is driving me insane.

column1: I'm giving up
column2: To be honest, I still don't know fully how to talk about this because a lot of my memories of what happened are hazy. I'll start from the beginning though, just to give you guys a general idea of what's going on. So two years ago, I was completely healthy. I got migraines, sure, but for most of my childhood and the brief time I'd spent as an adult (I was 20) I never even ran a fever. I was living in Denver, CO working with at-risk kids as a full-time volunteer. It was intense and grueling and exhausting work (60 hour high-stress work weeks mixed with having no money and living in a big city for the first time with an insane roommate) but it was also extremely rewarding. For the first half of the school year, everything was going great. Until around December, when I got bronchitis that just...wouldn't go away. When I went home for Christmas break, it had essentially progressed to pneumonia. The second half of the year, things got progressively worse. I lost my appetite completely, couldn't breathe well enough to walk longer than 10 minutes, couldn't climb the stairs. Eventually, I was so sick that I'd throw up anything I DID eat. My body was just constantly in pain. Everything hurt and nothing was getting better. I lost over a hundred pounds and was beginning to lose my hair. I managed to finish the program out and see my kids until their last day of school, but as soon as I stopped having to put on the uniform and go to school every day, I absolutely CRASHED. Everything that was already bad got even worse. My family ended up driving out to Denver (a 13 hour drive) and renting a hotel room. They put me in it and cleaned my apartment out for me. Then, they drove me home and instead of taking me back home with them, they brought me straight to the ER. My doctor told me then that I was extremely lucky I went in when I did. If I had waited until Monday when my doctors appointment was scheduled, then I likely wouldn't have made it. I was diagnosed with malnutrition, dehydration, pericardial effusion, heart failure, kidney failure, and, of course, organizing pneumonia. They tested me for everything under the sun. I saw just about every specialist in the hospital as they ruled out... Everything. I was tested from everything from rocky mountain fever to lupus to leukemia, and the tests came back consistently negative. They tested the fluid from around my heart, the bone marrow from my spine, my saliva, and probably a billion blood tests. While hospitalized, I ended up getting 9 blood transfusions because my hemoglobin kept dipping so low. My WBC was consistently going up while my RBC was consistently going down. My feet and legs were swollen like footballs. My CRP level was over 400 and I was on such a high level of oxygen that I couldn't leave my bed. I ended up transferring to Barnes Jewish because the hospital I was at just didn't have the resources to figure it out. Cue me getting tested for everything, again, plus the doctors being convinced that the only answer could be anorexia. (Lmao trust me, I'm the farthest thing from anorexic. I love food normally, this lack of appetite was a symptom, not the cause) They ended up almost releasing me just because they had run out of possible diagnosises when, finally, a miracle happened. Sort of. At this point, I've been in the hospital for 2 months. I'm no longer to the point of being near death, but I am still sick. My muscles have all atrophied, so walking is extremely painful. Of course they make me do it anyways, because that's how you get better. But I notice that while one leg is getting better, the other one is extremely painful. Turns out the ultrasound they'd done of my right leg before was inconclusive because I kept flinching away from the thingie. So they do an MRI. And what do they find? Vasculitis. Of course, they only find it in my leg. But I had similar symptoms in my left arm not that long before. The problem with that is having vasculitis on opposite extremities but NOWHERE else is extremely rare. I think I recall a doctor asking me if I'd ever done cocaine because there's a few rare cases in some other country where one particular strain of cocaine causes similar vasculitis symptoms. It was bizarre. But it was enough. They wanted to biopsy my leg, but my blood was too thin even after being pumped full of vitamin K and 2 plasma transfusions. So instead, they treated it the same way all autoimmune diseases can be treated. They gave me steroids. I improved almost immediately, to where I was sitting up in bed, coloring, laughing, and just generally felt...better. It wasn't a diagnosis, but it was SOMETHING and after 2 months of being tested for everything under the sun, it was a good feeling. They released me, I started seeing a rheumatologist, and things got better. I was on 80 mg of prednisone and was slowly tapering it with an increasing dose of Imuran, an immunosuppressant. Cut to a year later and my health is getting weird again. I'm getting recurring kidney stones and I've done the stupidest thing possible. I've stopped taking my medicine. I land myself in the hospital again, though it gets caught a lot faster this time. Because I've moved to a new state, I've been proactive in finding a rheumatologist, and he's taking my health very seriously. After some lab results come back with high inflammation markers, and I've lost my appetite again, he sends me to the ER. Again, a million tests are done. 2.5 weeks later, I'm released with no more answers than before. After an angiogram, it's revealed that my thyroid and ureters are inflamed. My doctor has a theory that I have IGG4 Related Disease. So I get both my ureter and my thyroid biposied. And... Nope. Of course, there's evidence of chronic inflammation. There's evidence of that in all my organs. But I've tested negative for IGG4 Related Disease. Again, there are no answers. Currently, I'm back on prednisone and Imuran. We"re tapering the prednisone slowly, but it doesnt look like Imuran is going to be enough to do the trick, so he's going to switch me to rituxin infusions. I think I may have to give up on a diagnosis and just hope the treatment works.

column1: Carb Coma ?
column2: My daughter is 13 for most of her life she has chronic abdominal illness she had a hard time tolerating food as an infant she was born prematurely , she projectile vomited , her hands and feet would turn blue as a baby. She had Gerd,reflux , esophagitis she was very fussy with foods as she continue to grow she continued to have the reflux problems she started getting chronic headaches and total body tightness what we began to notice is if we fed her foods specifically it started with Cheerios and pancakes from IHOP she would go into a drunken stupor for about 30 minutes she would then follow sleep from anywhere from 4 to 6 hours and then wake up with chronic and total body painIt is not abdominal pain we would see slight swelling at her lips and eyes when she would wake up her entire body hurt she says that her skin feels tight this used to happen once every few months then became once a month and has quickly escalated into weekly and almost daily after she wakes up there is a slow burn of her feeling just not right We have seen two top children‚Äôs hospitals in our area when they cannot get her to fit into a particular box they then tell us her issues maybe psychological that her body gets used to eating these foods and then makes the reaction happen I have a hard time agreeing with that because I have seen it happen so many times and the types of food that it happens with primarily was junkie carbohydrates and has now moved into other types of foods like dairy and nuts. . We are completely lost she is missing school she is being seen by medical professionals but we can‚Äôt get anywhere she has had every possible food allergy test they have suggested she has had gastric emptying and she has had endoscope she has had so many tests and they still tell us it‚Äôs psychological and I understand that there is things like conversion disorders but the scope and the frequency happens more and more she has seen psychologists and they give her coping strategies she‚Äôs been doing this since she is four years old she‚Äôs not a stressed child Her greatest life stress is that she eats food and passes out into this coma like state does anybody have any ideas or suggestions we are desperate to take this to the Internet

column1: 5 months of pain and no answers is making me feel hopeless
column2: I have high cfs pressure pushing on my optic nerve, severe vitamin D and B12, constant stomach pain and bloating. I‚Äôve had MRI‚Äôs, CT, chest X-ray, colonoscopy and about 15 blood tests. I‚Äôve also fallen behind of my third year of uni, lost my job and become isolated from most of my friends. I spend most of my days unable to focus or move much because of all the exhaustion and pain. I don‚Äôt want to die, but I‚Äôm also sick of living like this. I feel like I‚Äôve lost all the work I‚Äôve put into rebuilding my life over the last 5 years. I don‚Äôt know what I‚Äôm fighting for anymore

column1: I am exhausted... The doctors won't give me answers.
Undiagnosed Again
column2: Being undiagnosed is one of the loneliest times in my life. You have no community, no way to actually explain. I went through this 6 years ago when it took me 2 years to get a Crohn‚Äôs diagnosis and now again with what looks like Rheumatoid Arthritis. But the test and bs have just started. I have another doctors appointment tomorrow and I‚Äôve done convinced myself there will be no answers again, just more doctors and tests. It‚Äôs hard to stay strong when no one understands what you are going through.

column1: The Foot Bone's connected to the Uterus Bone, I guess?
column2: Now that I have your attention, allow me to share the genuinely bizarre foot pain that 7 specialists can't figure out. 8 days after having a neurectomy (for ACNES) I stood up and had a sharp, extreme pain in my large toe, right at the joint where it meets the foot. It felt like I'd broken it (I've sprained various parts of me well enough to know what that was like). When I went to get X-rays, they found that I was perfect, so I saw my GP. He noted the localized heat, swelling and redness, and told me I had gout. Which is an interesting diagnosis, because I was a 23 year old woman who doesn't consume alcohol at all. (For those of you that don't know: gout is virtually unheard of in women below menopausal age, other than in extreme alcohol addicts) After going back to a stand-in GP one day trying to get pain meds (that never helped anyway), she balked at the gout diagnosis, and sent me to the rheumatologist. The rheumatologist sent me to the orthopedic surgeon, who sent me to the OB/GYN. The clincher, and the real reason nobody can figure out why my foot hurts so much, is that it only hurts for about 3 days, *when I start my period*. After that the pain fades rapidly and after 7 days I'm better. When the pain is bad, my foot throbs, and I have to walk on the outside of my foot. *It doesn't show up outside of my menstrual cycle and I don't have menstrual cycles without the pain in my toe.* It's not a huge bother - like I can still do my daily errands - but it's just weird. I never have pain in between attacks and they always settle down by themselves. Painkillers don't make a dent. They've done x-rays, ultrasounds, bloodwork and an MRI and found some inflammation around my sesamoides, but that's really about it. Other than congenital asthma, I'm a hugely healthy individual. They've ruled out gout, arthiritis, rheumatism, damage to the bone and are now searching for endometriosis. In... in my toe. They're trying to find uterine tissue in my toe. I'm not saying it couldn't be there, but I am saying, you would expect to see that kind of thing on an ultrasound or MRI scan. Soooo... anybody got any cute ideas about what kind of demonic gremlin is wreaking havoc in my toe, and why it is collaborating with the one that's rented out a room in my uterus?

column1: Seeking Help with an Undiagnosed Illness (foreign objects that look like worms in throat, nose, etc.)
column2: Hello, I'm looking for any sort of help or information that might lead to a diagnosis and cure for these symptoms I've been experiencing for over ten years. It started with a lump around 2006/2007 underneath my ear, then I started to get sick a lot. It was flu like symptoms and sever headaches, body aches, and dizziness. My equilibrium was so bad I felt like I'd fall over even when sitting down and it got so bad I'd be at work and feel like I'd pass out while sitting there (a feeling of being lightheaded but you're sitting down). Every time they did a needle biopsy where the knot was I'd break out with these big pustule cyst type bumps and I felt like something was crawling underneath my skin on the left side. They've done several needle biopsies since this began and eventually they took out my tonsils because they were getting swollen, bleeding, and full of puss. They took out my wisdom teeth because they said that could cause an infection in trying to pinpoint where this might be, but as a result my lymph nodes swelled up underneath the knot. After that they cut out 2 of my lymph nodes to do a biopsy and the results didn't show anything, and after more of them swelled back up. I've been wishing to see a infectious diseases doctor, but none of my primary care physicians have been willing to refer me. Just recently I lost my insurance, so now I really don't know what my options are. I've been doing research and watching documentaries about parasites and I've found that I have a lot of the same symptoms described by the people in these documentaries. I found an episode of Monsters Inside Me that describes the dirofilaria worm and this seems pretty close to my experience with whatever is going with me. However I'm not positive, I've found a few other illnesses that seem like they could fit such as Angiostongyliasis and toxoplasmosis, but I can't be sure. It feels like there's something moving around mostly in my eye and temple area and I've seen movement and an object that looks like a worm in my eye. Then objects that also look worm-like or like larvae have come out of my nose and throat and it feels like there's something rooting around in my sinuses at times, like something digging. This whole thing affects my speech at times to the point where I feel like I've had slurred speech. I'll be talking to people and it just comes out wrong. It's affecting my cognitive functions. When I'm talking to people it feels like I can't communicate properly and like everything just comes out wrong. Because I don't have insurance I've had to try alternate methods and medications. In my research I came across Dr Sebi's Cell Food (the Advanced Package), it comes with a product called Lymphalin and I've been using it because it's supposed to help with the lymph nodes swelling. Using the package has been offering some relief from the pain, but it's still there and still pretty active throughout the day. Please any help or advice is welcome. I just really want to understand what is going on inside of me and what steps I can take to move forward and find a cure. {These are pics of the object in my eye as well as some of the stuff that has come out of my nose/throat, might want to magnify so you can see it better. The eye pics are pretty blurry because it was moving around as I was taking the picture}: [https://postimg.cc/gallery/2dqz29zkk/](https://postimg.cc/gallery/2dqz29zkk/) [https://postimg.cc/gallery/2oq1w2mhg/](https://postimg.cc/gallery/2oq1w2mhg/)

column1: help me please
column2: So, this is about something that started about 4-5 years ago. I started puking one day, it went away for a while at first. The doctors thought it was stomach acid but the medicine they gave me, didn't help. Eventually I started puking a couple times week, which then grew into puking like 20-30 times a day, literally. I have had countless hospitals and doctors visits and countless tests done. Nobody can seem to figure out why I puke so much but it effects me going to school and out in public. They gave me a pill to help calm the vomiting, that didn't work. They gave me a stronger one which works, but only for a certain time and I start puking again. Sometimes the pill doesn't work at all and I continue puking all day and night. It doesn't matter how much or how little I eat. It also doesn't matter what I eat. I wish it could just disappear and leave me alone but wishes don't work..I just want to be normalüò≠

column1: Please! Help is wlcome from anyone willing
column2: My name is Sarah, I am 20 years old and for the past 6-8 momths I have been experiencing unbelievable abdominal pains. I have described these pains to multiple doctors and specialists. They are crippling, bring-me-to-my-knees types of pains, I become short of breath, start sweating profusely, and often cry from the pain (I am not an easy crier, I have a very high pain tolerance). In words I would describe it as someone using a pitchfork to spaghetti noodle my insides. It starts just below my belly button, spreads to my hips, then wrap around and come up my back and lasts anywhere from 15 minutes to an hour and a half, usually without any warning. After a CT scan, manual pelvic exam, internal pelvic ultrasoubd, multiple urine tests, a blood test, meeting with a uroligist and more, ALL of my tests have come back normal, with the exception of blood in my urine. I do have kidney stones and ovarian cysts, but have been told that neither of those is the cause of my pain. I am 5‚Äô4‚Äù and 160lbs at my heaviest ‚Äî I have tried food journaling, changinging my diet, and losing weight. I am scheduled to meet with a GI specialist in 3 days, but I doubt that will give me any answers either. Please, though my boyfriend and family have been incredibly supportive, I am absolutely sick of dealing with this. I need answers, of any kind. I need you fellow redditors. Help me if you can...

column1: Undiagnosed neurological disorder
column2: I made a post on ask doctors back in February about my current condition to see if they had any ideas. https://www.reddit.com/r/AskDocs/comments/b4fiwb/undiagnosed_illness_and_hoping_for_a_solution/?utm_source=share&utm_medium=ios_app&utm_name=iossmf My condition is still the same. No improvements at all. I am in the US and currently trying to get approved for SSI disability. I would honestly prefer to work. I just don‚Äôt know what type of job I would be able to do. I was wondering if anyone has the same symptoms? If so, what do you do for work?

I‚Äôm on antibiotics for ten days before they decide to do scans. Lymph nodes aren‚Äôt really shrinking but it‚Äôs only day three. Thoughts? And it‚Äôs lymph nodes on my neck and near my breasts

column1: Loved one has had undiagnosed very low ferritin levels for months with weakness and other symptoms
column2: I've already posted much of what's below in another, non-reddit, forum, but they informed me that they weren't qualified to answer questions involving medical diagnoses, so I'm re-posting it here. \-------- I'm typing this on behalf of my mother. She has been feeling sick and weak for at least months and has gone to several doctors with no diagnosis. The problem is that the doctors don't communicate or share medical records, or, they are myopic and can't make diagnoses that fall outside their specialty. To get to the point, my mom's ferritin level has dropped from 9 to 7 in a month ( It's supposed to be in the 16 to 288 range for healthy individuals ). My mom's rheumatologist was concerned and sent her to hematologist who \*did nothing\*. He instead recommended that she should have a colonoscopy, but none of her other blood work or tests indicated that she had any type of gastrointestinal bleeding and she doesn't have dark stools . Since my mom saw her rheumatologist, my mom's ferritin dropped 2 more points. The sections of the blood work that are pertinent include the following : `Other blood results:` `IRON AND TOTAL IRON BINDING CAPACITY IRON, TOTAL Reference Range: 45-160 mcg/dL 67 - No Historical Data` `IRON BINDING CAPACITY Reference Range: 250-450 mcg/dL (calc) 468 H` `% SATURATION Reference Range: 16-45 % (calc) 14 L No Historical Data` `MCH 25.3 L Reference Range: 27.0-33.0 pg` `MCHC 30.6 L Reference Range: 32.0-36.0 g/dL` `RDW 16.4 H Reference Range: 11.0-15.0 %` We live in Spring Texas in the United States and my mom is using the government health care plan, which is horrible ( at least it is now, but it's all she can afford ). She's seen about a dozen or more doctors and none of them can seem to figure out what the problem is. We don't know quite what to do at this point. Anyway, I hope this is the correct forum for my question. If anyone has any recommendations, we'd be very grateful. Thank you, jdbtwo

column1: My Story
column2: My name is Brooke Journeaux. I am a 26 year old mother of two. I'll begin my story before I realized anything was wrong. I don't remember the exact date, but sometime in early 2017, I was walking through my kitchen when I experienced sharp, unbearable pain in both of my ears. My fianc√© was able to direct me to the bed to sit down when I started to experience tingling sensations that went up both of my arms. And then it was like my brain shut off. I did not want to be touched. I curled up in fetal position and began to hysterically cry and hyperventilate. I don't really remember how long it lasted, an hour maybe, but when I woke up the next day I felt like I had a hangover. I had severe brain fog. We decided it best to go to the ER, where I was told I had a panic attack. I've had them before, but this was the worst one up to that point. Fast forward to late 2017. My girls and I had moved in with my parents down in Tennessee, while I worked at a bank as a single mother, getting our lives back together. It was stressful, but I was making it. In early 2018 I began to start having these strange sensations like I was always on the verge of having a panic attack. I would get hot flashes and cold chills and my brain would just feel foggy. I remember one day, while dealing with a customer, my computer screen just whirlpooled, for lack of a better word. I just brushed it off as nothing serious. Then there was the day I did have a panic attack at work and had to go sit in the break room while it passed. I was confused, because other than these recent weird feelings, I was the happiest I had been in a long time, so there should have been nothing causing me to have panic attacks. Then it got to the point where if I was stuck in traffic on the way home I would get dizzy and feel like I was going to pass out. I just figured I wasn't eating enough, even though I snacked between meals all day long. My fianc√© moved back in with us April 2018 and the sensations would come and go, but I mostly felt fine and never felt the need to see a doctor about it. June of 2018 I noticed that I had lost most of the feeling in my right big toe. I thought it was weird, but it wasn't affecting me in any debilitating way, so I never got it looked at. July of 2018, I was involved in a hit run, in which the other person got away. I then had to spend the remainder of my savings account on buying a new car. A few weeks later I started to have battery issues with my new car, right before we had planned to take a week long vacation to go visit my family in South Carolina. I had to instead spend that money on getting my car fixed, so that was extremely stressful, as I hadn't seen my family there for several years. August 9, 2018. I went to my car on my lunch break. The last thing I ate were my blueberries and one of them had this awful chemical taste to it. I spit it out. I noticed that whenever I went back inside to work, the inside of my mouth had went numb on the left side. And the left side of my face began to feel weak. I went to answer the drive thru, which had feedback at times, that normally wouldn't bother me. This time it was extremely painful. I had hypersensitivity in my left ear and eye. I decided it best to go get checked out at an Urgent Care facility close to my home. He had me do a few things and concluded that my left side was weaker than my right and sent me to the ER. On the way there I began to get weird tingling sensations throughout my head. When I got there, they did an MRI, which came back inconclusive. I noticed that the pattern on my hospital gown made me dizzy. When I told them that, they blew it off and said they didn't know why that would be happening. I got sent home after they told me I had some sort of combination of Bell's Palsy and Trigeminal Neuralgia. They referred me for a follow up with a neurologist. I woke up the next day feeling completely fine. It wasn't until that evening that I had more issues. I was watching a movie with my girls. As soon as the movie went off and I went to move my head, everything went extremely blurry. I got extremely dizzy and my arms immediately started to tingle and go numb. I called my fianc√©, who was at work at the time, completely freaking out and had him come home. It wasn't going away so we called an ambulance. They did a heart test, I forget what it's called. But it came back fine and they told me that it was the same thing I was dealing with the previous day and to schedule an appointment with a neurologist. The next few months were so crazy, that I'm not sure if this next part will be in chronological order. My memory is, and always has been awful. I talked to my supervisor about what was going on and went ahead and took my vacation hoping that by the time that week was up, I would be able to return to work. Well I wasn't. I was having almost constant dizziness as well as a lot of vertigo. I would get sharp pains and pressure behind my eyes and ears. Sometimes it would last only a few minutes, and others it would last for hours. A lot of the time I would have to just lay on the couch because I couldn't handle the amount of effort it took my brain to walk around. This eventually led to me being unable to drive or work. I saw a neurologist and he suspected Vestibular Migraines and put me on a week long round of steroids. This only made my symptoms more intense. Shortly after that I began to start having some of my weirder symptoms. Often it felt like I was trying to walk through water, as it seemed harder to move my legs. Sometimes they would just give out on me. I only fell all the way down once, and that was more due to vertigo. Here, I will list some of my symptoms: -vertigo, dizziness, lightheadedness, weakness, pain/pressure behind ears/eyes, numbness/tingling in random places, electric wave feelings going through my brain, confusion, trouble speaking when confused, a complete lack of thoughts at all, stabbing pains in random parts of my body, chest tightness, sore scalp, tinnitus, phantom noises, nystagmus, feeling of my brain being on fire, body swaying, heavy head, migraine, reduced hearing, leg stiffness, leg weakness, feeling of chest on fire, hot flashes, cold chills, heat made my dizziness and vertigo worse, while cold made my pain worse. These are just what I could think of off the top of my head. I can tell you that we tried a few different medications. The first one I tried was Amitriptyline, which didn't do anything but help me sleep, but I continued to take it for that reason. I didn't notice anything was wrong, but my fianc√© noticed a change in my mood, where I was more irritable and more depressed. I had been taking it a little over a month, when I attempted suicide with my Amitriptyline. This was a rare side effect of this medication that almost killed me. I never in my right mind would do that to my family, regardless of what is going on with myself. So I discontinued the Amitriptyline and tried Nortriptyline, recommended by my ENT. I stopped taking it after the second day, as it made me absolutely miserable. It was as if my symptoms were magnified 10x. After that, I was done with medication for awhile and instead tried Vestibular Rehab. She found clonus of my lower extremities and her opinion was that this is more than just a vestibular issue. This rehab seemed to help more than anything else I had tried and she recommended I start doing yoga. So I looked up some YouTube videos and made it a daily routine to do yoga. I also began to eat mostly unprocessed foods and am taking 250mg of Magnesium daily. I slowly became less stressed, and my symptoms slowed down enough to where I could get a part time job in January 2019. I got some light sensitivity glasses and went to work. After awhile, I began to feel great, enough so that I got the Front Desk Manager position at my job. Every now and then, if I didn't eat right or I got too stressed, I would get dizzy and confused but it wasn't ever really bad. There was only one day that I had to leave work early. So for months I went with hardly any symptoms. I did a second round of Vestibular Rehab when they did start to pop back up. Before I left my original neurologists office, he was able to refer me to Vanderbilt for a second opinion, MRI, and balance test. My MRI was "essentially unremarkable." I have questions about my MRI, because I saw some things that didn't look right to me, but I'm not a radiologist so I'll get a second opinion on that. My balance test showed my left ear was 27% weaker than my right. They talked about the possibility of Meneire's Disease, Multiple Sclerosis, or mini strokes. But it was then concluded that I was "too young" for it to be any of these things. I've had just about every blood test you can think of, which have all come back normal. Before I made the trip to Vanderbilt, I would like to note that a lot of the doctor's I was seeing for my issues tried to tell me it was a physical manifestation of my childhood trauma. I know my body. And this is not all in my head and I was enraged, as was my fianc√©, when they tried to tell me that's what it was. We recently have moved back to KY, under not the greatest of circumstances. It's been stressful, to say the least. I've been here about a week now and only a few days after arriving, I have begun to have symptoms again, each day getting a little bit worse. It started with just some slight dizziness, then vertigo and nystagmus. My legs have been giving out. Last night the Bell's Palsy thing happened again on my left side, except for this time, the top of my left arm and leg are both numb. I had issues pulling my thoughts together and speaking, which seems to have resolved for the most part today, but I am still getting dizziness, vertigo, and hot flashes/cold chills. My vision in my left eye is now worse than that of my right eye, which has a prescription. Before I conclude this, I will throw out there that my father has been experiencing similar symptoms for years now and he has yet to get a diagnosis because of his lack of insurance and money. My aunt has Multiple Sclerosis and wants me to look into that possibility. I do not want to be one of those cases that takes 17 years to diagnose, when it's to the point of no return. I have two young children I am wanting to homeschool, but if I "relapse", for lack of a better word, it won't be an option. I have probably left bits and pieces out, but it has been a long journey and an abundance of chaos.

column1: PLEASE HELP ME!! UNDIAGNOSED PAIN CONTINUING TO GO OVERLOOKED!!
column2: I first experienced this pain when I was 16 years old. I was at the time on my period and I brushed it off as terrible cramps. It felt like the worst cramping/stabbing/sharp pain I've ever felt in my life, it was so severe it brought me to my knees and took my breath away. I didnt feel that pain for a couple years and once I was 18, the same pain started coming back. This time it didn't come with my periods. It would hit me as random episodes with absolutely no warning or correlation to anything. It seemed like it happened anywhere from between 8 to 6 months. It was always the same pain, it was so bad it would keep me from doing anything. I have gone to the ER for this 3 or 4 times now and its cost so much money and time. I've had countless doctor's appointments and each time, they come up with nothing. A couple doctors have questioned if it was in my head or not, thinking I might have depression or anxiety that manifested into physical pain. I've never been diagnosed with either and I personally do not think it's a mental problem. Usually these episodes last up to 12-20 hours and then go away. The one I have now, which started Sunday night at 12 am, is still here and its rendered me completely useless. I was asleep and early in the morning I was woken up with how intense the pain got. I could barely get out of bed or stand up straight, I got my mom and she said I was totally gray. My ears started ringing to the point I couldn't hear and I was super nauseous. I went to the ER shortly after I woke up, which was monday, and it was the worst pain I think I've ever experienced. For those of you who know what it's like to have an IUD placed, it feels like the first initial cramp that absolutely shocks you, but goes away after a few seconds. It's that pain, but continuous for over 24 hours now. It hurts so incredibly bad for so long now, I dont know what to do. I can't live like this and I need help. All my bloodwork, ultrasounds, CAT scans, HIDA scans, everything looks normal. The only thing is that for a few months now, my white blood cell count and glucose level has been elevated. Every doctor says I seem totally healthy and they can't find a reason for the pain. The pain initially starts in my stomach, above my belly button and then my uterus starts hurting. At first it's always bareable and then the debilitating pain just hits me. The worst of the pain is centered around my uterus, ovaries, and even my private areas. I can't sit down, I can't spread out, no laying on my stomach to see if it helps. There's nothing to do that takes the pain away even a little bit. Ibuprofen doesnt seem to help, unless it's the extra strong dosage from hospitals. It hurts my bladder/uterus area so incredibly bad when I pee or put any sort of pressure on it. It's never lasted this long and it really is ruining my life. I dont know if I can keep living like this, just waiting for the next episode of severe, sickening pain. I need help from anyone who might know what I'm talking about, or I'm just going to keep wasting money on ER trips that only dull the pain momentarily, followed up by more and more doctor's visits - if I can even last that long before I see if I can just take out my uterus and ovaries. Thank you for reading if you made it this far. I need help.

column1: Never ending stomache pain
column2: Im posting about my girlfriend of 6 years. Sense she was about 12 shes had episodes of extreme abdominal pain she discribes it as a stabbing pain thats right in the center of her body about where the rib cage ends. Its not a constant pain but when she gets her bouts they can last anywhere from a cple days to weeks to months. When its bad she cant even move or walk ive never in my life seen anyone in such a state. She is now 32 and the doctors and hospitals never have any answers shes seen numerous specialists been on a slew of diff medications and nothing seems to help they removed her gaul bladder maybe 6mnths ago and hasnt had an episode intill just this last friday. Our local er keeps her for a few hours then sends her in in the same state she came saying theres notjing they can do for her all the while shes hasnt even beem able to keep water down and has been in bed in constant pain crying and moaning. I hate to see her in this state and shes at her wits end dealing with it. Thamkyou for everyone who has taken the time to read and i appreciate all input

column1: I've been in hell with no escape.
column2: I'm just in constant pain. The entire time. Iron rods shooting through my shins, stepping on sharp rocks, needles being pushed into my shoulder joint, the bones in my calf deep freezing in an instant. Not always all at once. Often one at a time. And there are periods when I have none... That almost makes it worse. Makes me realize how bad it has slowly become. How much I've been fighting to maintain a normal life. A life where I go to class, and out with friends. A life where I don't wince every 5 minutes, or control my breathing to stop tears forming in my eyes. I'm tired all the time. I just want a nap. Just 5 years should do it. The meds my doctor's gave me all stop working over time, and I don't know if it's because the pains are getting worse, or my body's getting used to the drugs, or a combination of both. But I do know that the drugs they're trying me on are several categories above where I started a year ago. My GP hasn't a clue what's causing it, or who to refer me to. The rhumatologist was the same. I'm not sure I'll survive another 7 months on a waiting list. Not with all of me intact. Even typing this I have pains in my thumb, my ankle, my collarbone, through my lungs, and my hands are twitching randomly. It makes it hard, when I'm going through all this, while still dealing with the ongoing grief from my brothers cancer journey, and his death. And so desperately wishing it's not cancer. And I feel like I can't say anything, because despite the length I have no label. I can't say I have... Anything. Because we have no idea. We're not even sure it's a nerve disorder. It may be psychological. And I feel like crap even mentioning it, because it's nothing compared to what my little brother went through with his chemo, and coming to terms with his mortality and death. So I suck it up, and bury it deep, but I'm scared. Terrified. What if life's like this now? What if there's never an answer? What if the damage is already done? If you've made it this far, I'm sorry it's so long. Just had a lot of very confusing things to get out.

column1: I can‚Äôt write certain letters and numbers
column2: I have this problem where I cannot write certain letters. It is kind of hard to explain, but I am going to do my best. I didn‚Äôt notice it until a few years ago. I went to write the letter ‚ÄúS‚Äù and my mind just froze. My pen was to the paper, getting ready to write my name, and I just couldn‚Äôt make my hand move. I kept starting over and over to write the ‚ÄúS‚Äù and I finally got it, but it was messy looking. Growing up I do not recall having any problems with writing letters. I have always done well in my English classes, and I love to read, and journaling used to be a big thing for me. I have never been diagnosed with a learning disorder either. I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs a learning disorder, and I‚Äôll explain why. If I am not looking down at the paper, or if I close my eyes, I can write the letters that I have trouble with while writing a word. The letters(and numbers) that give me the most trouble are: S, O, P, Q, D, C, G, J, O, Q, S, and U. Sometimes the letters V, J, and W. With the ‚ÄúW‚Äù I have noticed I have problems when I try to use curved lines instead of straight ones to make the W. The numbers are: 2, 3, 8, 9, 0. When I look at the numbers and letters I have a hard time writing, they all seem to be curved in one way or another. Making letters out of straight lines are fine. I will be writing a sentence, or a word, and when I come to a difficult letter my hand stops, and I have to force my hand to make the movement to finish the letter/number. This is while writing words, and sentences, etc. If I am making the letters by themselves I don‚Äôt typically have a problem. I feel my hand tense up whenever I start to write, and I sometimes get cramps from holding my pen too tight while trying to write. I can write a letter or number in the air, mimicking the way it would be written on paper, but when it comes time to it, I struggle. I also have no problems typing or reading. Here‚Äôs a little about me: I do struggle with dysthymia, general anxiety disorder, and PTSD. I am on antidepressants (I noticed this problem before the antidepressants). I get told a lot that I am tense, and I just recently had to go to the dentist because of a toothache, but nothing was wrong with my tooth, I was just clenching my jaw too tight, and putting a lot of pressure on my teeth. I clench my jaw when I am stressed, and I am constantly stressed. I do have a lot going on in my life, but even when things seem somewhat calm, I am stressed about something. I get told a lot I‚Äôm going to worry myself to death, which at this point I believe because I also suffer from GERD, and digestive health has been linked with stress. I do smoke weed, and socially drink (maybe a couple of times a month). I do smoke regularly. I didn‚Äôt start smoking until I was 21 (I‚Äôm 23 now) and I didn‚Äôt start drinking until I was 21 as well. I noticed this problem before I started smoking. I have found a couple of ways of going around these problems. For example for the letter 3, I have found it not a problem to start the number if I put a straight line at the top, and then finish the rest. I just started a new job where writing is a huge part of it, and I am becoming more and more frustrated with myself over this, and I don‚Äôt know what it means, or what to do about it. I do not have health insurance, so no I have not seen a doctor/neurologist about this. I am looking desperately for answers, and I keep coming up short. So if anyone knows anything about this, or experiences this, please share your knowledge. I cry about this frequently, and just want to fix it.

column1: What Is Wrong With My Foot?
column2: So my right foot, just inbetween the ankel and the bottom of my foot, will hurt severely. To the point i have to limp around, cant bend it, or put weight on it. It'll even be sore to the touch right below my ankel. This happens if i wear high heels, use it to much ( walk long distances). Or sometimes it just happens randomly. Nothing i do ever relives the pain. No ibprufien. Not a hot bath. Not staying off of it or elavating it. Ive had xrays done but they show nothing. Bloodwork shows slightly high inflammation but nothing alarming. Ive been to my GP and a rumutolgist ( or however you spell it) and they have no answers for me. Does anybody have any idea what could be wrong? This has been going on since i was 15 and im 24 now.

column1: Not being taken seriously
column2: I‚Äôve talked about this in another subreddit but here we go. For over a year I‚Äôve had lots of swollen lymph nodes and horrible constant lung pain. I went to the doctor multiple times but I just gave up after a while because I was told that I just had a cold and that it would go away. It did not. Around five months ago I started to get really bad joint and muscle pain all over. I went to the doctor a few times and got x-rays on my legs and lots of blood tests but everything came out fine. Soon after that, I developed chronic stomachaches and headaches that do not go away. I went to the doctor again but nothing came of it. After that I started to experience trouble balancing and tremors in my hands. I went to the doctor AGAIN today but she just told me she didn‚Äôt know what was happening and sent me home. Everything is extremely painful and it stops me from being able to hang out with people and doing things that I love. No one will listen to me or take me seriously and I just want to know what is happening so I can make it stop. (Sorry for any spelling or grammar mistakes I‚Äôm exhausted so I can‚Äôt focus well)

column1: i‚Äôm so frustrated
column2: for almost exactly a year i‚Äôve been experiencing frequent vomiting, frequent dizziness, constant fatigue, nausea, and headaches, and i‚Äôm so weak that sometimes i can‚Äôt walk or even sit up. i‚Äôve been to many doctors and specialists, had a gastric emptying study done, an upper endoscopy, xrays, mris, ct scans, everything. and we can‚Äôt figure out what is going on with me. i‚Äôve struggled with anxiety my whole life and i can tell it‚Äôs not anxiety. i recently turned 20, i used to travel to different countries, i had lots of friends and was always doing something fun and exciting. now i can barely leave my home unless it‚Äôs to go to work. i‚Äôm so young and it‚Äôs so frustrating that these are supposed to be the best years of my life and i‚Äôm stuck here, quite literally suffering. i‚Äôm not asking any questions or looking for advice, just looking to vent to people who may understand.

column1: Depresssion or something else ?
column2: Hi everyone, Recently (the last 4-5 months) I have been feeling quite down. And iv had so many symptoms. Before this I thought I knew my body, but it turns out I‚Äôm beginning to completely not understand myself. Il just get straight to it and try to create a cohesive pattern of events and maybe someone would have ideas or know what‚Äôs going on with me. So I had a really stressful time in my life (I think), at a work placement, I was doing work from 9-5 then doing more work at home after, trying to secure a job. However I didn‚Äôt quite click with the people and I felt they didn‚Äôt like me much, eventually we kept arguing and they would go out of their way to make things difficult for me. So I left. Now I usually have a lay back attitude yes these people annoyed me, yes it wasn‚Äôt a good part of my life, but I learned a lot and just chalked it up to them being not very nice people and that‚Äôs that. I didn‚Äôt feel stressed, during it. I got over it fast. Then I started to do small bits of work from home for myself and learn more. Things were great ! I was actually glad I left, I kept up with my new routine. But then one day I just felt a wave of depression come over me, but I wasn‚Äôt feeling sad or angry but I couldn‚Äôt shake the feeling. I did more exercise eat healthier all to try to lift the mood change I noticed. Well this kept going for on for a couple month and I was getting fed up. Then my symptoms took a nose dive. I began to feel extreme fatigue, joint pain I mean I was so tired that I felt I never slept at all, then for about 2 weeks into the third month I kept getting insomnia (which has now gone). I‚Äôve been getting spots on my face which were never there before. So I went to the doctors for a blood test, it came back that I was low in Phosphate and my vitamin D levels were borderline, and they put me on Phosphate Sandoz 500mg Phosphorus. I took that for about a week and I felt a bit better. However overtime the symptoms came back again. Decided to have another blood test and my phosphate was LOWER than before, so he gave me TONS of the stuff. But this time it didn‚Äôt help. So I went back desperate to fix the fatigue. Because it had for awhile now interfered with my life, I can‚Äôt even remember what feeling energised feels like. So iv stopped taking the phosphate as it‚Äôs not helped but every day I take 2000 UI of Vitamin D. (Because vitamin D is harmless, I think) but nothing seems to change. I wake up in the morning feeling exhausted, my back and shoulders feel tense and stiff, and it‚Äôs the worst in the morning. Eventually through out the day it kind of simmers down, but then I‚Äôm left with a constant anxious feeling. But I have NOTHING to feel anxious about ! it‚Äôs just there ! My doctor chalked it up to Fibromyalgia (which I don‚Äôt believe) but also that it could be depression (which I‚Äôm starting to convince myself it is) but the thing is I don‚Äôt feel sad, I feel miserable because of how I feel everyday, not the other way around. Yes my life was rough for a bit but iv been through far worse, but im very fortunate and I have great supportive family and friends. However what iv also noticed accompany my fatigue is constant gut discomfort, and I struggle to go to the toilet very often. The doctor also noticed I had a nasal polyp. Which brings me to the other part of my puzzle, could vaping cause this nasal congestion and be ruining my life ? iv vaped for years and had no problem prior and I only vape 100% VG and nicotine on a low dose, no flavouring. I‚Äôm also hoping it isn‚Äôt vaping as I will struggle to quit it. I don‚Äôt want to go back to actual smoking. I just have so much wrong with me, which makes me down. I‚Äôm so confused. Does any of this hit a note with anyone ? or am I just depressed, without knowing it ? If anyone wants any more info ask questions I would be so thankful ! Any bit of knowledge in any of these areas could potentially improve my quality of life :)

column1: Dealing with being undiagnosed
column2: I know so many of us have different issues, but I was wondering how you deal with being undiagnosed. Personally, I often feel unheard and like I‚Äôm making a big deal out of nothing, even when I‚Äôve had it confirmed by doctors that there is a problem, we just don‚Äôt know what it is. What are your tips on living without a diagnosis, and not feeling hopeless?

column1: Fibromyalgia or Hypothyroid
column2: I have severe insomnia. 4 months now. Cannot fall and stay asleep. Go days without sleeping. Sleeping pills work a few days then quit working. I had palpation when taking sleeping pills hr went from 65 to 150 in nothing flat. When I have palpitations hard to breathe. Has not done that since. I have Rheumatoid so I had bad joint pain. I had chest pain like burning of the rib cages a month before the insomnia. Back and neck pain. Before the insomnia I was sleeping 9 hours and felt unrefreshed. I have muscle spasm and myoclonus. Tingling and pain in the hands and feet. When I do not sleep burning all over. Been told the abnormal lab value was a high calcium which I has started taking a supplement 2 weeks prior and a low TSH but not enough to send me to an endocrine doctor.
